definition: many/much/often/a lot of/numerous/more/in excess/how (to what extent)/multi-/Taiwan pr. [duo2] when it means "how"
to put/to place/to release/to free/to let go/to let out/to set off (fireworks)

sentences.english: Emily had to cast on extra stitches to make the pullover wide enough.
sentences.chinese: 埃米莉为了把套衫织得宽些，只好多放几针。

sentences.english: Ask and casus, tradespeople says dissoluting fee more.
sentences.chinese: 问及原因，店主只说多放浪费。

sentences.english: Can I have some more juice for the minibar?
sentences.chinese: 可否多放一些果汁在冰箱内？

definition: to add less (of a spice etc)
to put/to place/to release/to free/to let go/to let out/to set off (fireworks)
to work extra hours/to do overtime
to improve taste/to make sth palatable
to skim/lightly touching the water (as the dragonfly in the idiom 蜻蜓點水|蜻蜓点水)/skin-deep
chicken bouillon powder (PRC)/essence of chicken, concentrated chicken stock sold as a tonic (Tw)
